docs.name: Vocat API
docs.info: Vocat is a teaching and learning platform that facilitates qualitative and quantitative assessment of a range of media. Built as a collaboration between the Center for Teaching and Learning at Baruch College, City University of New York and Cast Iron Coding of Portland, Oregon, the tool is in active development.
docs.copyright: Copyright 2015 Baruch College, City University of New York

resources.name: Submissions
resources.full_description: Submissions tie together the media, discussion posts, and evaluations that are created in response to a student's work on a project. Submissions are created automatically, on the fly by Vocat. Vocat will always return a one submission for every group and student that can submit for a given project. The existence of a submission, then, should not be taken to mean that a student has taken action on a project. For performance reasons, when the API renders collections of submissions, it uses a brief serializer that does not include all submission details. To access the full details of a submission, API clients should request the single submission.

methods.name: for_project

apis.short_description: returns brief submissions the given project

methods.full_description: For a sample of the response, see the for_creator_and_project endpoint, above.
